intro: Compsoneura, commonly known as the bluebell, is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features strap-like, grassy leaves. Compsoneura thrives in woodland habitats and prefers well-drained, loamy soil. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for gardens and naturalized areas.
